revised_title: Chaotic Combustion of Solids and High-Density Fluids Near Points of Strong Resonance
tldr: The author investigates the chaotic combustion of solids and high-density fluids near points of strong resonance. They find that the loss of stability of steady, planar combustion waves occurs via Hopf bifurcation for large values of a parameter related to the activation energy of the reaction. The study shows that chaotic solutions can be predicted from nonlinear stability theory near multiple eigenvalue points, leading to a better understanding of complex combustion phenomena.
